yes: doesn't matter, ubuntu-desktop is not needed once it's installed
ubuntu-desktop is a "meta" package, used to pull in other packages. if new packages are added to it, or rename, etc. then you won't get them if you don't have ubuntu-desktop..
never used the default install before
since upgrading goes by the packages you have... it may upgrade what you have, but there's no guarantee you're getting a "full" or proper upgrade
but in general i think it's safe to not have ubuntu-desktop if you aren't upgrading... i would just re-add it before upgrading
